content.question: Which of the following best explains how the dystrophin protein is synthesized by certain muscle cells of an individual but not by other cell types?

choices.label: Each cell has different genes as a result of changes that occur during development and cell specialization.
The presence of different transcription factors in different cell types results in differential gene expression.
A cell can only translate mRNA transcripts that have gene-specific sequences that are recognized by the ribosomes.
The promoter region of the gene is necessary for expression to occur, and this region is only present in certain cell types.

content.answer: The presence of different transcription factors in different cell types results in differential gene expression.
